Structs/PostgreSQLError.html#/s:7pgswift.name: reason
Structs/PostgreSQLError.html#/s:7pgswift.abstract: The last error message from the connection

Structs/PostgreSQLError.html#/s:7pgswift.name: init(code:connection:)
Structs/PostgreSQLError.html#/s:7pgswift.abstract: Create an error. This method will lock the connection

Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.name: allow
Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.abstract: first try a non-SSL connection, if that fails, try a SSL connection

Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.name: prefer
Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.abstract: first try an SSL connection, if that fails, try a non-SSQL connection

Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.name: require
Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.abstract: only try an SSL connection. If a root CA file is present, verify the certificate in the same way as if verify-ca was specified. This is the default value

Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.name: verifyCA
Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.abstract: only try an SSL connection, and verify that the server certificate is issued by a trusted certificate authority (CA)

Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.name: verifyFull
Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html#/s:7pg.abstract: only try an SSL connection, verify that the server certificate is issued by a trusted CA and that the requested server host name matches that in the certificate

Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html#/s:7pgswi.name: port
Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html#/s:7pgswi.abstract: port on host to connect to. Defaults to 5432

Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html#/s:7pgswi.name: dbname
Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html#/s:7pgswi.abstract: the name of the database to use

Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html#/s:7pgswi.name: connectTimeout
Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html#/s:7pgswi.abstract: how long (in seconds) to wait before giving up on opening a connection

Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html#/s:7pgswi.name: appName
Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html#/s:7pgswi.abstract: the name of the application connecting. Shown in admin functions.

Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html.name: Name
Structs/ConnectParam/Name.html.abstract: supported names for connection parameters. Defined at PostgreSQL docs.

Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html.name: SSLMode
Structs/ConnectParam/SSLMode.html.abstract: possible modes for sslMode parameter. Defined at PostgreSQL docs.

Structs/ConnectParam.html#/s:7pgswift12C.name: init(_:_:)
Structs/ConnectParam.html#/s:7pgswift12C.abstract: creates a ConnectionParam with a key and value

Structs/ConnectParam.html.name: ConnectParam
Structs/ConnectParam.html.abstract: A single parameter to open a connection to a postgresql server

Enums/NativeType.html#/s:7pgswift10Nativ.name: matches(_:)
Enums/NativeType.html#/s:7pgswift10Nativ.abstract: Test if the native type’s class is the same as the type parameter

Enums/NativeType.html#/s:7pgswift10Nativ.name: metaType()
Enums/NativeType.html#/s:7pgswift10Nativ.abstract: returns the metatype for this native type. For instance, .string returns String.self

Enums/PGType.html#/s:7pgswift6PGTypeO11u.name: unsupported
Enums/PGType.html#/s:7pgswift6PGTypeO11u.abstract: unsupported data types have a native data type of string and return a string represenation of the value, or an empty string

Enums/PGType.html#/s:7pgswift6PGTypeO10n.name: nativeType
Enums/PGType.html#/s:7pgswift6PGTypeO10n.abstract: the native type (int, string, date) used for this PGtype

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: alreadyOpen
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: called open() when the connection was already opened

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: badResponse
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: the server sent back an irregular response

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: emptyQuery
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: thrown when getting a single value and no rows were returned

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: unsupportedDataFormat
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: thrown when a requested value type does not match what is supported by the PGType

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: invalidRowNumber
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: thrown when PGResult is asked to get a value for invalid row number

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: invalidColumnNumber
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: thrown when PGResult is asked to get a value for invalid column number

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: invalidColumnName
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: thrown when PGResult is asked to get a value for an invalid column name

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: internalQueryFailed
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: a query hardcoded in this library failed

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: invalidQuery
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: query does not meet requirements of function call

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: invalidType
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: when caller specifies a type and result is not that type

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: floatsMustbeDoubles
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: when setting parameters for a query, float columns must be specified as doubles

Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.name: callerError
Enums/PostgreSQLStatusErrors.html#/s:7pg.abstract: when user code in a closure fails

Enums/NativeType.html.name: NativeType
Enums/NativeType.html.abstract: Swift types a database value can be returned as

Classes/QueryParameter.html#/s:7pgswift1.name: valueType
Classes/QueryParameter.html#/s:7pgswift1.abstract: the type this parameter was requested to be

Classes/QueryParameter.html#/s:7pgswift1.name: valueCount
Classes/QueryParameter.html#/s:7pgswift1.abstract: the number of bytes the value takes up

Classes/QueryParameter.html#/s:7pgswift1.name: valueBytes
Classes/QueryParameter.html#/s:7pgswift1.abstract: The caller owns this value and is responsible for calling .deallocate() on it

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: status
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: the status returned from the server

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: wasSuccessful
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: true if the result was .commandkOk, .tuplesOk, or .signleTupe

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: statusMessage
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: the server’s description of the status

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: errorMessage
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: the error message associated with these results

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: rowCount
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: the number of rows returned

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: columnCount
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: the number of columns returned

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: returnedData
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: true if the status indicates data was returned

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: rowsAffected
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: for non-select queries (such as insert/update/deletee) the number of rows affected

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: insertedOid
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: if a single row was inserted, the Oid of that row. Returns -1 of there is no value

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: columnNames
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: names of columns indexed by column number

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: columnTypes
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: the type of the column

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: getValue(row:column:)
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: returns the value as the actual native type (String, Int, Bool, etc.)

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: getValue(row:columnName:)
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: finds the index of the first column matching columnName then calls getValue(from:column:) with it

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: getDataValue(row:column:)
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: Gets the specified value as a data object.

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: getStringValue(row:column:)
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: Gets the specified value as a string. This works for more types than nativeType.string

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: getBoolValue(row:column:)
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: Gets the specified value as a bool if nativeType is .bool

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: getDateValue(row:column:)
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: Gets the specified value as a date if columnType.nativeType == .date

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: getIntValue(row:column:)
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: Gets the specified value as an integer if columnType.nativeType == .int

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: getFloatValue(row:column:)
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: Gets the specified value as a float if columnType.nativeType == .float

Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.name: getDoubleValue(row:column:)
Classes/PGResult.html#/s:7pgswift8PGResu.abstract: Gets the specified value as a double if columnType.nativeType == .double or .float

Classes/PGResult/Status.html.name: Status
Classes/PGResult/Status.html.abstract: the possible status returned from the server

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: init(host:port:user:password:dbname:sslMode:)
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: Initializes with a fixed set of connection parameters

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: init(cloning:)
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: Creates a connection using the same parameters as the specified connection

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: open()
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: opens the connection to the database server

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: close()
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: closes the connection to the database server

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: lastErrorMessage
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: the currently reported last error message from the server

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: isConnected
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: true if the connection is currently open

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: serverVersion()
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: Returns the version of the server. Only works if a connection is open.

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: withTransaction(body:)
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: Wraps a closure in a transaction. If an error is thrown,

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: execute(query:)
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: Executes the query and returns the results

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: executeBinary(query:)
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: Execute the query and returns the results. Internally transfers data in binary format

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: getSingleRowValue(query:)
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: Returns the value of row 0, column 0 of a query that returns 1 row and 1 column

Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.name: listen(toChannel:queue:callback:)
Classes/Connection.html#/s:7pgswift10Con.abstract: Creates a dispatch read source for this connection that will call callback on queue when a notification is received

Classes/Connection.html.name: Connection
Classes/Connection.html.abstract: Represents a connection to a PostgreSQL server

Classes/PGResult.html.name: PGResult
Classes/PGResult.html.abstract: Encapsulates the server response from executing a query

Classes/QueryParameter.html.name: QueryParameter
Classes/QueryParameter.html.abstract: Representation of a parameter to replace a placeholder in a query
